original: Netti
analyzed: na itti
translated: The Guide

original: Paṭiniddesavāra🔽Vibhaṅga 10
analyzed: paṭiniddesa vāra  vibhaṅga
translated: The Reversal Section🔽The Analysis

original: Vevacanahāravibhaṅga
analyzed: ve vacana hāra vibhaṅga
translated: The Analysis of the Synonyms

original: Tattha katamo vevacano hāro?
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ vevacanaḥ hāro
translated: Herein, what is the Mode of Conveying Synonyms?

original: “Vevacanāni bahūnī”ti.
analyzed: vevacanāni bahūni iti
translated: “There are many synonyms” .

original: Yathā ekaṁ bhagavā dhammaṁ aññamaññehi vevacanehi niddisati.
analyzed: yathā ekam bhagavā dhammam aññamaññehi vevacanehi niddisati
translated: Just as the Blessed One demonstrates one idea by means of many synonyms,

original: Yathāha bhagavā—
analyzed: yathā āha bhagavān
translated: as in the case of the Blessed One’s saying:

original: “Āsā ca pihā abhinandanā ca,🔽Anekadhātūsu sarā patiṭṭhitā;
analyzed: āsā ca pihā abhinandanā ca  aneka dhātūsu sarā patiṭṭhitā
translated: “Hope, longing, and approval,🔽With craving for many a kind of being,

original: Aññāṇamūlappabhavā pajappitā,
analyzed: aññāṇa mūla ppabhavā pajappitā
translated: Are rooted in ignorance, and so is self-delusion:

original: Sabbā mayā byantikatā samūlikā”ti.🔽Āsā nāma vuccati yā bhavissassa atthassa āsīsanā avassaṁ āgamissatīti āsāssa uppajjati.🔽Pihā nāma yā vattamānassa atthassa patthanā, seyyataraṁ vā disvā “ediso bhaveyyan”ti pihāssa uppajjati.
analyzed: sabbā mayā byantika tā sa mūlikā ati  āsā nāma vuccati yā bhavissassa atthassa āsīsanā avassam āgamissati iti āsā assa uppajjati  pihā nāma yā vattamānassa atthassa patthanā seyyataram vā disvā edisaḥ bhaveyyanti pihā assa uppajjati
translated: I have uprooted all of them by the root” .🔽Hope is said to be the hoping for the existence of what is not yet come into presence, the hope that “It will come into presence” .🔽Longing is the longing for what is in process of coming into presence, or the longing that “May it be like this” when one sees something better.

original: Atthanipphattipaṭipālanā abhinandanā nāma, piyaṁ vā ñātiṁ abhinandati, piyaṁ vā dhammaṁ abhinandati, appaṭikūlato vā abhinandati.
analyzed: attha nipphatti paṭipālanā abhinandanā nāma piyam vā ñātim abhinandati piyam vā dhammam abhinandati a paṭikūlataḥ vā abhinandati
translated: Approval is the approving of what has come into presence, or the approving of what is not disagreeable, as in the case of one who approves of a dear person or a dear state or a dear idea.

original: Anekadhātūti cakkhudhātu rūpadhātu cakkhuviññāṇadhātu, sotadhātu saddadhātu sotaviññāṇadhātu,
analyzed: aneka dhātu uti cakkhu dhātu rūpa dhātu cakkhu viññāṇa dhātu sota dhātu sadda dhātu sota viññāṇa dhātu
translated: ‘Many elements’ means the eye element, the form element, the eye-consciousness element; the ear element, the sound element, the ear-consciousness element;

original: ghānadhātu gandhadhātu ghānaviññāṇadhātu, jivhādhātu rasadhātu jivhāviññāṇadhātu,
analyzed: ghāna dhātu gandha dhātu ghāna viññāṇa dhātu jivhā dhātu rasa dhātu jivhā viññāṇa dhātu
translated: the nose element, the smell element, the nose-consciousness element; the tongue element, the taste element, the tongue-consciousness element;

original: kāyadhātu phoṭṭhabbadhātu kāyaviññāṇadhātu, manodhātu dhammadhātu manoviññāṇadhātu.
analyzed: kāya dhātu phoṭṭhabba dhātu kāya viññāṇa dhātu manaḥ dhātu dhammadhātu manas viññāṇa dhātu
translated: the body element, the touch element, the body-consciousness element; the mind element, the idea element, the mind-consciousness element.

original: Sarāti keci rūpādhimuttā keci saddādhimuttā keci gandhādhimuttā keci rasādhimuttā keci phoṭṭhabbādhimuttā keci dhammādhimuttā.
analyzed: sarāti keci rūpa adhimuttā keci sadda adhimuttā keci gandha adhimuttā keci rasa adhimuttā keci phoṭṭhabba adhimuttā keci dhamma adhimuttā
translated: ‘All’ means some are devoted to form, some are devoted to sound, some are devoted to smell, some are devoted to taste, some are devoted to touch, some are devoted to ideas.

original: Tattha yāni cha gehasitāni domanassāni yāni ca cha gehasitāni somanassāni yāni ca
analyzed: tattha yāni cha geha sitāni domanassāni yāni ca cha geha sitāni somanassāni yāni ca
translated: Herein, the six kinds of household joy and the six kinds of household grief and

original: cha nekkhammasitāni domanassāni yāni ca cha nekkhammasitāni somanassāni, imāni catuvīsapadāni
analyzed: cha nekkhamma sitāni domanassāni yāni ca cha nekkhamma sitāni somanassāni imāni catuvīsa padāni
translated: the six kinds of renunciation joy and the six kinds of renunciation grief, these twenty-four

original: taṇhāpakkho, taṇhāya etaṁ vevacanaṁ.
analyzed: taṇhā pakkhaḥ taṇhāya etam
translated: are the craving side, and this is a synonym for craving.

original: Yā cha upekkhā gehasitā, ayaṁ diṭṭhipakkho.
analyzed: yāḥ cha upekkhāḥ gehasitāḥ ayam diṭṭhi pakkho
translated: The six kinds of equanimity devoted to the home life are the view side.

original: Sāyeva patthanākārena dhammanandī dhammapemaṁ dhammajjhosānanti taṇhāya etaṁ vevacanaṁ.
analyzed: sāya iva patthanā ākārena dhamma nandī dhamma pemam taṇhāya etam
translated: The same delight in ideas, love of ideas, and esteeming of ideas in the aspect of aspiration are synonyms for craving.

original: Cittaṁ mano viññāṇanti cittassa etaṁ vevacanaṁ.
analyzed: cittam manaḥ viññāṇanti cittassa etam vevacana
translated: Mind, mentality, and consciousness are synonyms for consciousness.

original: Manindriyaṁ manodhātu manāyatanaṁ vijānanāti manassetaṁ vevacanaṁ.
analyzed: man indriyam manaḥ dhātu mana āyatanam vijānanāti manaḥ sa itam vevacana
translated: The mind faculty, mind principle, mind base, and mind’s cognizance are synonyms for mind.

original: Paññindriyaṁ paññābalaṁ adhipaññā sikkhā paññā paññākkhandho dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo🔽ñāṇaṁ sammādiṭṭhi tīraṇā vipassanā dhamme ñāṇaṁ atthe ñāṇaṁ anvaye ñāṇaṁ khaye ñāṇaṁ
analyzed: paññindriyam paññābalam adhipaññā sikkhā paññā paññākkhandho dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgo  ñāṇam sammādiṭṭhi tīraṇā vipassanā dhamme ñāṇam atthe ñāṇam anvaye ñāṇam khaye ñāṇa
translated: The understanding faculty, understanding power, higher understanding training, understanding, understanding category, investigation-of-ideas enlightenment factor,🔽knowledge, right view, penetration, insight, knowledge of ideas, knowledge of meaning, knowledge of language, knowledge of how to teach,

original: anuppāde ñāṇaṁ anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ aññindriyaṁ aññātāvindriyaṁ cakkhu vijjā
analyzed: anuppāde ñāṇam aññindriyam aññātāvindriyam cakkhu vijjā
translated: knowledge of the unarisen, knowledge of the state of non-confusion, knowledge of the state of being a knower, knowledge of what is the path and what is not the path, knowledge of the field, knowledge of the disposition, knowledge of the way, eye, clear vision,

original: buddhi bhūri medhā āloko, yaṁ vā pana yaṁ kiñci aññampi evaṁ jātiyaṁ, paññāya etaṁ vevacanaṁ.
analyzed: buddhi bhūri medhā āloko yam vā pana yam kiñci aññam pi evam etam
translated: clear knowledge, science, wisdom, understanding, sagacity, sagaciousness, sagacity faculty, sagacity power, sagacity enlightenment factor, right view, and whatever else of the kind is found, are all synonyms for understanding.

original: Pañcindriyāni lokuttarāni, sabbā paññā.
analyzed: pañca indriyāni lokuttarāni sabbā paññā
translated: The five faculties are supramundane. All understanding is supramundane.

original: Api ca ādhipateyyaṭṭhena saddhā, ārambhaṭṭhena vīriyaṁ, apilāpanaṭṭhena sati, avikkhepaṭṭhena samādhi, pajānanaṭṭhena paññā.
analyzed: api ca ādhipateyya ṭṭhena saddhā ārambha ṭṭhena vīriya apilāpana ṭṭhena sati avikkhepa ṭṭhena samādhi pajānana ṭṭhena paññā
translated: Furthermore, faith is in the sense of predominance, energy in the sense of instigation, mindfulness in the sense of non-forgetting, concentration in the sense of non-distraction, understanding in the sense of act of understanding.

original: Yathā ca buddhānussatiyaṁ vuttaṁ itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā.
analyzed: yathā ca buddhānussatiyam vuttam iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā
translated: And as it is said in the recollection of the Buddha: “Thus indeed that Lord was an Arahant, perfectly enlightened, endowed with clear vision and virtuous conduct, a Well-Farer, Knower of the worlds, incomparable Trainer of men to be tamed, Teacher of gods and humans, enlightened and blessed.”

original: Balanipphattigato vesārajjappatto adhigatappaṭisambhido catuyogavippahīno agatigamanavītivatto
analyzed: bala nipphatti gataḥ vesārajja ppattaḥ adhigata ppaṭisambhidaḥ catu yoga vippahīnaḥ agati gamana vītivatto
translated: He had reached the culmination of the exercise of the powers, had attained perfect confidence, had attained discriminative understanding, had abandoned the four bonds of an ordinary man, had gone beyond the plane of no-training,

original: uddhaṭasallo nirūḷhavaṇo madditakaṇḍako nibbāpitapariyuṭṭhāno bandhanātīto ganthaviniveṭhano🔽ajjhāsayavītivatto bhinnandhakāro cakkhumā lokadhammasamatikkanto anurodhavirodhavippayutto
analyzed: uddhaṭa sallaḥ nirūḷha vaṇaḥ maddita kaṇḍakaḥ nibbāpita pariyuṭṭhānaḥ bandhana atītaḥ gantha viniveṭhano  ajjhāsaya vītivattaḥ bhinna ndhakāro cakkhumā loka dhamma samatikkanto anurodha virodha vippayutto
translated: had drawn out the dart of sorrow, had cut off the bonds of existence, had unyoked the beast of burden, had laid down the burden, had attained his own goal, had destroyed the fetter of becoming,🔽had passed beyond the plane of training, had attained the plane of no-training, had attained the eye of Dharma, had gone beyond the plane of darkness, was endowed with vision, had crossed over doubt,

original: iṭṭhāniṭṭhesu dhammesu asaṅkhepagato bandhanātivatto ṭhapitasaṅgāmo abhikkantataro
analyzed: iṭṭha aniṭṭhesu dhammesu asaṅkhepa gataḥ bandhana ativatto ṭhapita saṅgāmaḥ abhikkantataro
translated: had no more perplexity, was not dependent on others for the teachings, had attained certainty about the True Dhamma, had attained the confidence to proclaim the True Dhamma thus:

original: ukkādharo ālokakaro pajjotakaro tamonudo raṇañjaho aparimāṇavaṇṇo appameyyavaṇṇo
analyzed: ukkādharaḥ āloka karo pajjota karo tamonudaḥ raṇañjahaḥ aparimāṇa vaṇṇaḥ appameyya vaṇṇaḥ
translated: He is the one who has risen up, the light-maker, the enlightener, the dispeller of darkness, the giver of insight, the one of immeasurable glory, the one of incomparable glory,

original: asaṅkheyyavaṇṇo ābhaṅkaro pabhaṅkaro dhammobhāsapajjotakaroti ca buddhā bhagavantoti
analyzed: asaṅkheyya vaṇṇaḥ ābhaṅkaraḥ pabhaṅkaraḥ ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ iti
translated: the one of inconceivable glory, the maker of light, the maker of radiance, the enlightener with the radiance of Dhamma.🔽These are synonyms for the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: ca buddhānussatiyā etaṁ vevacanaṁ.
analyzed: ca buddha anussatiyāḥ etam vevacana
translated: in the recollection of the Buddha.🔽And as it was said in the Recollection of the Dhamma:

original: Yathā ca dhammānussatiyaṁ vuttaṁ svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhi.
analyzed: yathā ca dhammānussatiyam vuttam su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi
translated: “The Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed One, visible here and now, timeless, inviting inspection, onward leading, and directly experienceable by the wise.”

original: Yadidaṁ madanimmadano pipāsavinayo ālayasamugghāṭo vaṭṭūpacchedo suññato atidullabho taṇhakkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
analyzed: yat idam mada nimmadanaḥ pipāsa vinayaḥ ālaya samugghāṭaḥ vaṭṭu upacchedo suññataḥ ati dullabhaḥ taṇha khayaḥ virāgaḥ nirodhaḥ nibbāna
translated: That is to say: the dispelling of conceit, the stilling of craving, the uprooting of clinging, the cutting off of the round, the voiding of the effluents, the destruction of craving, dispassion, cessation, Nibbana.

original: “Asaṅkhataṁnantamanāsavañca,🔽Saccañca pāraṁ nipuṇaṁ sududdasaṁ;🔽Ajajjaraṁ dhuvaṁ apalokitaṁ,
analyzed: asaṅkhata nanta manāsavañca  saccam ca pāram nipuṇam su duddasa  ajajjaram dhuvam apalokita
translated: “The unconditioned, the end of suffering, the taintless state,🔽The truth, the other shore, the subtle, the hard to see,🔽The undecaying, the permanent, the unchangeable,

original: Anidassanaṁ nippapañca santaṁ.🔽Amataṁ paṇītañca sivañca khemaṁ,
analyzed: a nidassanam nippapañca santa  amatam paṇītam ca sivam ca khema
translated: The unmanifest, the undifferentiated, the peaceful,🔽The deathless, the sublime, the auspicious, the secure,

original: Taṇhakkhayo acchariyañca abbhutaṁ;
analyzed: taṇhakkhayaḥ
translated: The destruction of craving, the wondrous, the marvelous,

original: Anītikaṁ anītikadhammaṁ,
analyzed: anītikam anītika dhamma
translated: The ageless, the ageless-by-nature,

original: Nibbānametaṁ sugatena desitaṁ.🔽Ajātaṁ abhūtaṁ anupaddavañca,🔽Akataṁ asokañca atho visokaṁ;
analyzed: nibbānam etam sugatena desita  a jātam a bhūtam an upaddavañca  a katam a sokam ca atho visoka
translated: This is the Deathless taught by the One Well-Gone.🔽Unborn, unbecome, unmade, unfabricated;🔽Uncompounded, unoriginated, not come into being;

original: Anūpasaggaṁnupasaggadhammaṁ,
analyzed: an upasagga an upasagga dhamma
translated: Not subject to decay, not subject to cessation:

original: Nibbānametaṁ sugatena desitaṁ.🔽Gambhīrañceva duppassaṁ,🔽uttarañca anuttaraṁ;
analyzed: nibbānam etam sugatena desita  gambhīram ca iva duppassa  uttarañca anuttara
translated: This is the Deathless taught by the One Well-Gone.🔽It is deep, hard to see, hard to understand,

original: Asamaṁ appaṭisamaṁ,🔽jeṭṭhaṁ seṭṭhanti vuccati.
analyzed: asamam appaṭisama  jeṭṭham seṭṭhan ti vuccati
translated: unsurpassed, incomparable,🔽unequaled, matchless, supreme.

original: Leṇañca tāṇaṁ araṇaṁ anaṅgaṇaṁ,
analyzed: tāṇam araṇam
translated: It is a shelter, a refuge, a haven, a final relief, a truth,

original: Akāca metaṁ vimalanti vuccati;
analyzed: vuccati
translated: a truth that is not otherwise.

original: Dīpo sukhaṁ appamāṇaṁ patiṭṭhā,
analyzed: dīpaḥ sukham appamāṇam patiṭṭhā
translated: It is an island, a haven, a refuge, a truth, a final relief,

original: Akiñcanaṁ appapañcanti vuttan”ti.
analyzed: akiñcanam appapañcanti vuttan ti
translated: a truth that is not otherwise.

original: Dhammānussatiyā etaṁ vevacanaṁ.
analyzed: dhamma anussatiyā etam vevacana
translated: This is a synonym for the recollection of the Dhamma.

original: Yathā ca saṅghānussatiyaṁ vuttaṁ suppaṭipanno ujuppaṭipanno ñāyappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno🔽yadidaṁ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho āhuneyyo🔽pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassa, sīlasampanno
analyzed: yathā ca saṅgha anussatiyam vuttam su ppaṭipannaḥ uju ppaṭipannaḥ ñāya ppaṭipannaḥ sāmīci ppaṭipannaḥ 🔽yat idam cattāri purisa yugāni aṭṭha purisa puggalāḥ esa bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ āhuneyyaḥ 🔽pāhuneyyaḥ dakkhiṇeyyaḥ añjali karaṇīyaḥ anuttaram puññakkhettam lokassa sīla sampanno
translated: And just as it was said in the case of the recollection of the Sangha, so it should be here too, mutatis mutandis.

original: samādhisampanno paññāsampanno vimuttisampanno vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno sattānaṁ
analyzed: samādhi sampannaḥ paññā sampannaḥ vimutti sampannaḥ vimutti ñāṇa dassana sampanno sattāna
translated: endowed with concentration, endowed with wisdom, endowed with freedom, endowed with the knowledge and vision of freedom, of beings

original: sāro sattānaṁ maṇḍo sattānaṁ uddhāro sattānaṁ esikā sattānaṁ surabhipasūnaṁ pujjo
analyzed: sāraḥ sattānam maṇḍaḥ sattānam uddhāraḥ sattānam esikā sattānam surabhi pasūnam pujjaḥ
translated: He is endowed with concentration, endowed with wisdom, endowed with deliverance, endowed with the knowledge and vision of deliverance. He is the best of beings, the choice of beings, the excellent of beings, the most worthy of beings, the chief of beings, the most excellent of beings, the most worthy of offerings of beings,

original: devānañca manussānañcāti saṅghānussatiyā etaṁ vevacanaṁ.
analyzed: devānam ca manussānam ca ati saṅgha anussatiyai etam vevacana
translated: honoured by gods and men. This is a synonym for recollection of the Community.🔽And as it was said in the case of recollection of virtue,

original: Yathā ca sīlānussatiyaṁ vuttaṁ yāni tāni sīlāni akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni
analyzed: yathā ca sīla anussatiyam vuttam yāni tāni sīlāni akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni a sabalāni a kammāsāni
translated: whatever virtue is unbroken, untorn, unblotched, unmottled,

original: ariyāni ariyakantāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṁvattanikāni,
analyzed: ariyāni ariya kantāni bhujissāni viññu ppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhi savattanikāni
translated: noble, praised by the wise, not misapprehended, and conducive to concentration,

original: alaṅkāro ca sīlaṁ uttamaṅgopasobhaṇatāya, nidhānañca sīlaṁ sabbadobhaggasamatikkamanaṭṭhena,🔽sippañca sīlaṁ akkhaṇavedhitāya, velā ca sīlaṁ anatikkamanaṭṭhena, dhaññañca sīlaṁ
analyzed: alaṅkāro ca sīlam uttama aṅga upasobhaṇa tāya nidhānam ca sīlam sabbadobhagga samatikkamana ṭṭhena  sippam ca sīlam akkhaṇa vedhitāya velā ca sīlam an atikkamana ṭṭhena dhaññam ca sīla
translated: virtue is an ornament, because it is an adornment for the most excellent head; virtue is a treasure, because it is the transcending of all poverty;🔽virtue is a craft, because it is the hitting of the mark; virtue is a boundary, because it is not transgressed; virtue is grain,

original: daliddopacchedanaṭṭhena, ādāso ca sīlaṁ dhammavolokanatāya, pāsādo ca sīlaṁ volokanaṭṭhena,
analyzed: dalidda upacchedana ṭṭhena ādāso ca sīlam dhamma volokana tāya pāsādo ca sīlam volokana ṭṭhena
translated: because it is the cutting off of poverty; virtue is a mirror, because it is the looking at the Dhamma; virtue is a palace, because it is the looking down ;

original: sabbabhūmānuparivatti ca sīlaṁ amatapariyosānanti sīlānussatiyā etaṁ vevacanaṁ.
analyzed: sabba bhūma anuparivatti ca sīlam amata pariyosānam ti sīla anussatiyā etam vevacana
translated: And just as it is said of the recollection of generosity, “On an occasion, bhikkhus, when a noble disciple is recollecting generosity thus, he is at that time mindful, his mind is not distracted,” so too is it said of the recollection of virtue, and so on.🔽And just as it is said of the recollection of generosity, “On an occasion, bhikkhus, when a noble disciple is recollecting generosity thus, his mind enters into that state of voidness internally, and he either attains the rapture of voidness or else enters and dwells in the signless concentration of mind,” so too is it said of the recollection of virtue, and so on.🔽And just as it is said of the recollection of generosity, “ Generosity is its near enemy, the deathless element is its culmination,” so too is it said of the recollection of virtue, and so on.🔽And just as it is said of the recollection of generosity, “ Generosity is its near enemy, the deathless element is its culmination,” so too is it said of the recollection of the deities, and so on.🔽And just as it is said of the recollection of generosity, “ Generosity is its near enemy, the deathless element is its culmination,” so too is it said of the recollection of peace, and so on.🔽And just as it is said of the recollection of generosity, “ Generosity is its near enemy, the deathless element is its culmination,” so too is it said of the recollection of death, and so on.🔽And just as it is said of the recollection of generosity, “ Generosity is its near enemy, the deathless element is its culmination,” so too is it said of the recollection of in-breaths and out-breaths, and so on.

original: Yathā ca cāgānussatiyaṁ vuttaṁ yasmiṁ samaye ariyasāvako agāraṁ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṁvibhāgaratoti cāgānussatiyā etaṁ vevacanaṁ.🔽Tenāha āyasmā mahākaccāyano “vevacanāni bahūnī”ti.
analyzed: yathā ca cāga anussatiyam vuttam yasmin samaye ariya sāvakaḥ agāram ajjhāvasati mutta cāgaḥ payata pāṇi vossagga rataḥ yāca yogaḥ dāna savibhāga rataḥ iti cāga anussatiyā etam vevacana  tena āha mahākaccāyanaḥ vevacanāni bahūni iti
translated: And just as it is said of the recollection of generosity, “ Generosity is its near enemy, the deathless element is its culmination,” so too is it said of the foundations of mindfulness, and so on.

original: Niyutto vevacano hāro.
analyzed: niyuttaḥ vevacanaḥ hāraḥ
translated: And just as it is said of the recollection
